tweet: This morning, I joined a group of Alaskans in my D.C. office for our weekly "constituent coffee." They are in town advocating on issues important to them and their organizations. Thanks, everyone, for making the long trek out! pic.twitter.com/gdE9uHPpcv

Last Friday, 262 men and women from all corners of the globe gathered in Anchorage to take the oath of allegiance to the United States. It was an honor to be on-hand to witness their oath, and to celebrate with them as American citizens. pic.twitter.com/ovvS9VUM8Y

On Friday evening, I joined the @AmericanLegion National Commander, Brett Reistad, to mark the Legion’s 100th Anniversary at the Arctic Rec. Center in Anchorage. Glad to celebrate with proud members from posts all across Alaska! #Team100 #AmericanLegion100 pic.twitter.com/G6oGAJlHcW

On Friday, I toured the IBEW 1547 Tom Cashen Training Center. The team has set a new standard with the Veterans Electrical Entry Program. Alaska is now first in the nation to implement this program, training transitioning service members to become qualified electrical workers. pic.twitter.com/FoNUBXmVVO

Benno Cleveland, a Vietnam #veteran and two-time Purple Heart recipient, was pivotal in helping to correct this injustice. I was honored to present Benno with a signed copy of the bill in Fairbanks, along with a pen the @potus used to sign this important legislation. pic.twitter.com/5pECzF2KwU

A few weeks ago, @potus signed a bill that included our #Alaska Native #Veterans Land Allotment Act, which enables AK Native veterans who served during the Vietnam War era to apply for their congressionally-mandated land allotment, which many missed due to their service.

I appreciate @ComdtUSCG  Schultz for recognizing the importance of placing new assets & infrastructure in #Alaska, and for working with the delegation to finally advance the planning, acquisition and build-out of America’s first new polar #icebreaker in a generation.

The U.S. cannot realize the potential of the #Arctic without the technology necessary to protect our interests there. The @USCG just took another vital step toward securing America's place in this region, awarding the contract for a new polar icebreaker.  https://sen.gov/W002  pic.twitter.com/vLqTc4PQAK

Really enjoyed meeting with Professor Jim Arkell’s Business Law Class this weekend at @uafairbanks. Great give-and-take about important issues. I hope you all had a joyous and restful holiday weekend. Julie and I wrapped up our Easter festivities with an amazing dinner of Alaskan salmon and moose ribs, cooked by Fairbanks Bishop Chad Zielinksi, along with a few of our family and friends. pic.twitter.com/pN9BqidrZU

The American people, our allies, and free people around the world will never yield to the cowardly acts of terrorists. May all those celebrating the joy of Easter and Passover today offer up their prayers for the many victims and their families. #SriLanka

A big group of students from Teeland Middle School, in Wasilla, stopped by my office recently. Great kids with great questions. Thank you to the parents, teachers and chaperones who are helping these young Alaskans experience their nation’s capital! pic.twitter.com/mEHNjM1Wke

Jason has a strong background in rural development, having directed energy, resource and biomass projects for Ahtna, and having served as executive director of the Copper Valley Development Association. I look forward to working with him.

Congrats to Jason Hoke, of Glennallen, on being appointed to lead the Denali Commission. Alaska’s-own Meghan Redmond, of Chief Ivan Blunka School in New Stuyahok, has been honored as the 2019 National Assistant Principal of the Year! Congratulations, Meghan, on this huge honor, and thank you for your dedication to our kids.  https://sen.gov/LNNY  pic.twitter.com/LSRLJUbJrd

If your foundation was damaged in the November 30th quake, you may be eligible for additional assistance. @FEMA is encouraging you to appeal so they can use the new guidance to assess those damages. Call the FEMA hotline at 1-800-621-3362. #Alaska #earthquake
I am pleased to learn that, as a result our conversation, @FEMA updated their guidance, specific to this disaster, regarding foundation damage.
I recently spoke to Acting @FEMA Administrator Pete Gaynor regarding FEMA’s response to the 2018 #Alaska earthquake and the frustrations some Alaskans are having trying to get help from the agency.

With increased attention & traffic in #Arctic, it’s important that those who live in region have seat at the table in developing policy. Her hope is take the “Setsoo ‘Yeh” program (Athabascan for “My Grandmother’s House”) to more communities across the Interior and throughout Alaska. Yesterday, I had the opportunity to honor this very special woman as our Alaskan of the Week.

I’m grateful for counsel + support @ABAEsq & @LSCtweets have given on legislation I’ve worked on to provide more legal services to victims and survivors of domestic and sexual violence. Working together, we can help women all across the country get the help they need. #DVBriefing

Since serving as Alaska’s AG, and throughout my time in the Senate, I’ve been a staunch supporter of @AlaskaLegal and our many courageous pro bono advocates. Their work is vital to ensuring that we have equal access to justice under the law. #SAAM #LSCDV #DVBriefing

I was humbled to receive the 2019 ABA Justice Award from the @ABAEsq yesterday after an important briefing on Capitol Hill by @LSCTweets about the value of legal aid for survivors of #domesticviolence. #SAAM #LSCDV #DVBriefing pic.twitter.com/ABbLwG77xz

It is imperative that America’s chief legislative body, the U.S. Senate, underscores our commitment to the people of #Taiwan. I look forward to supporting Senate Resolution 13, which reaffirms the objectives of the Taiwan Relations Act.

I firmly believe that intimidation campaigns by #China aimed at isolating #Taiwan must be met by an American policy that reaffirms our vital alliances in the region and respects the right of the Taiwanese people to direct their own destiny.

The Act codified the basis for continued commercial, cultural & other relations between our two peoples. Now, after decades of a productive friendship w/ the democratic island, we are at another pivotal moment in the trilateral relationship between the U.S., #China, and #Taiwan.

40 years ago, President Jimmy Carter severed America’s ties with the island of #Taiwan while establishing a diplomatic relationship with the communist People’s Republic of #China. The U.S. Senate at the time rebuffed Carter’s move, overwhelmingly passing the Taiwan Relations Act.

As I’ve said before, our country will never realize its full potential if we don’t stop this. I want to thank Senator Gillibrand for her advocacy, and I look forward to building more support among my colleagues on this important effort. #EndDV #SAAM #NoMore

.@SenGillibrand and I have introduced the Choose Respect Act, legislation to build on Alaska’s home-grown initiative and launch a national media campaign aimed toward changing the culture of violence that tolerates abuse. #SAAM  https://sen.gov/W0QQ  pic.twitter.com/PchRC9uapV

My colleagues in the Senate and I voted overwhelmingly to confirm John Abizaid, my former boss and CENTCOM commander, as our next ambassador to Saudi Arabia. Tomorrow, we mark the 70th anniversary of the signing of the Treaty of Washington (1949), which established @NATO – commonly viewed as the most successful alliance in history.

But it’s also important to remember some sacrifices do not have a price tag. More than 1,000 non-U.S. @NATO soldiers have paid the ultimate sacrifice combatting terrorism alongside American troops in Afghanistan.
The Secretary also noted that President @realDonaldTrump’s push for @NATO member countries to contribute their share of the alliance’s defense budget is important, and we are making progress.

Glad to attend a joint address of Congress this morning by @NATO Secretary General @jensstoltenberg. In his speech, the Secretary reiterated a sentiment I have shared many times: one of America’s great strategic advantages is that we are an ally-rich nation. https://twitter.com/jensstoltenberg/status/1113455093943238657 …
